description: A Core Control control is an object in a Core Control module. Modules expose these controls that CC messages can be sent and received to communicate changes to a control property. The valueNumber and valueString are special properties intended for fast realtime messaging.

index.description: The index is used to identify a control in the CC protocol for scalable, low bandwidth messaging.

type.description: The type of control messages that are broadcast by this control. This helps message receivers understand messages and helps adapters know how to map messages netween modules.

receiveType.description: The type of control message it will receive, if different than the send type. This helps and adapter map it to a different module. Typically, model modules receive the same type that is sent. Often, a surface module uses a different type. For example, a surface may send delta values with a rotery encoder but receive continuous values for display.

name.description: A readable name such as 'Fader.' It can be localized and change freely.

default.description: The default value of the control

units.description: The string displayed after a numerical value such as 'dB' or 'kHz.'

color.description: A CSS color value for application specific use.

displayMode.description: An array of keywords that can be used to represent the control in a useful manner.
